item.title: One Health: From Idea to Action
item.description:
One Health: From Idea to Action

This is a short video scribe that is meant to provide an overview of the "One Health" concept. "One Health" promotes collaboration across the scientific disciplines, and emphasizes the interconnectedness between human, animal, and environmental health.

item.title: The unexpected ways climate change harms your health
item.description:
The unexpected ways climate change harms your health

Climate change is bad for your health. There's no question that the impacts of a warming world - harsher heat waves, increased flooding - will put a strain on our nation's public health. Take one example: studies predict some 11,000 additional heat-related deaths during summers about 15 years from now.

item.title: Launch of the Rockefeller Foundation-Lancet Commission on Planetary Health
item.description:
Launch of the Rockefeller Foundation-Lancet Commission on Planetary Health

Sir Andrew Haines delivers the introduction from the launch in Islamabad.

item.title: The planet's health is essential to prevent infectious disease
item.description:
The planet's health is essential to prevent infectious disease

The Zika virus, now detected in 42 countries, is only the latest in a series of diseases establishing a new normal for pandemics. Sars ravaged South China in 2003, Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (Mers) shocked the Middle East in 2012, and Ebola devastated west Africa in 2014.

item.title: Why action on forests now is essential to all our futures
item.description:
Why action on forests now is essential to all our futures

While forests once provided subsistence for local people, for generations clearing forested land has also been good for global business, providing immediate food security for the world. Put simply, forests have been worth more dead than alive.
